title: How to Play a Sorcerer in Diablo

steps.headline: Name your Sorcerer.
steps.description: Try to name her something you will enjoy.

steps.headline: Think about which stats you will invest in.
steps.description: (Energy is a good thing to have, but it's value will drop off over time. Most of the best Diablo 2 Sorcerers only used the base 35 Energy.)

steps.headline: Think of which element you want to invest in.
steps.description: Fire, Ice, Lightning. Pouring all skill points into a single element is a risky investment, as a Fire sorc taking on fire immune creatures will result in you needing to hit it with melee. Try investing in one main element, with one other element as a backup.

steps.headline: Get Teleport.
steps.description: This one skill is one of the most useful in the game. (Only invest in one point.)

steps.headline: If you need mana regeneration, invest a few points in "Warmth".
Read the sorc's synergy skills and invest in them.
steps.description: IE: get lots of Ice bolt points for Blizzard.

steps.headline: Invest in the element mastery.
steps.description: Lightning mastery, Frost Mastery, Fire mastery.

steps.headline: Dealing with Bosses: Sorcs have a long range on most of their skills, so there's little need to be close to a boss.
Find a weapon that helps your build.
steps.description: No need to get a +1 icebolt staff when you're a fire sorc.
